part1.title: Part A: The Basics (Who & When)
part1.description: This part helps us understand your role and timeline for Vietnam market entry or improvement.
part1.instructions: Please choose the one answer that best matches your current situation.

questions.text: What is your role regarding the brand's Vietnam strategy?

options.text: Decision Maker: Owner / Founder / Director.
Execution Lead: Marketing Manager / Brand Manager.
Researcher: Assistant / Analyst / Intern.
Partner: Distributor / Agency looking for collaboration.

questions.text: What is your timeline for executing a Vietnam entry or fix?

options.text: Urgent: Immediately (Next 30 days).
Planned: Next quarter (Q2/Q3).
Active Repair: We are already active but need to fix performance now.
Browsing: Just researching; no specific date.

part2.title: Part B: Market Readiness (The "Truth" Check)
part2.description: This part helps us understand your current market presence and readiness in Vietnam.

questions.text: Which statement best describes your brand's current footprint in Vietnam?

options.text: Invisible: No official shops, no distributor, no social media.
Visible but Silent: We have social media pages, but they are inactive or just reposting global content.
Stuck: We are trying to enter, but cannot get a distributor to sign.
Active & Selling: We have a distributor and active sales channels.

questions.text: What is the legal/compliance status of your products in Vietnam?

options.text: Not Started: No registration or paperwork begun.
In Progress: Paperwork submitted but no final numbers yet.
Gray Zone: Selling via hand-carry/cross-border (unregistered).
Fully Compliant: Products are registered with notification numbers ready.

questions.text: Where is your physical inventory located right now?

options.text: Origin Country: We have not shipped any product to the region.
Regional Hub: Stock is in Singapore/Thailand/HK (Cross-border shipping).
In Vietnam (Blocked): Stock is here but held by customs/partners.
In Vietnam (Ready): Stock is in a local warehouse, ready to ship today.

questions.text: If a customer wants to buy your product right now, what is their experience?

options.text: Dead End: There is no link; they cannot buy it.
Friction: They must DM us or find a gray-market reseller.
Seamless: We have an active official store (Shopee/TikTok/Lazada).
Cross-Border: They buy from our HQ website or Global Platform (Shopee Int/Olive Young) that ships to Vietnam.
Local Online: We have an official Vietnam online store (Shopee Mall/TikTok Shop/Lazada).
Local Offline: We are listed in retail stores (Guardian, Hasaki, Department Stores) but have no online shop.
Omnichannel: We have both official online stores and offline retail partners.

part3.title: Part C: The "Pain" Probe (The Diagnosis)
part3.description: This part helps us understand your specific challenges and pain points in the Vietnam market.

questions.text: How confident are you that you know *exactly* why a Vietnamese customer buys (or ignores) your product?

options.text: Guessing (Zero Data): We have no local data. We are assuming they act like our global customers.
Vanity Data: We see views and likes, but we don't know if they are real buyers.
Partial Truth: We get questions, but we don't know which "trust details" close the sale.
High Confidence: We have clear funnel data (Click → Add to Cart → Buy) and know where they drop off.

questions.text: [Budget] What is your biggest financial fear regarding the Vietnam market right now?

options.text: The "Black Hole": Pouring marketing budget into ads/KOLs with zero measurable return.
Inventory Trap: Shipping product there and having it sit in a warehouse expiring.
Distributor Fees: Being forced to pay huge listing fees/support fees without guaranteed sales.
Low Margins: We are selling, but the cost to acquire each customer (CAC) is too high.

questions.text: [Distributor Friction] If you are talking to partners/distributors, what is the #1 reason they haven't signed yet?

options.text: "Too Small": They say we lack brand awareness or volume.
"Show Me Proof": They want to see local sales data or traction before they commit.
"Pay to Play": They are asking for a huge upfront investment that we can't risk.
N/A: We aren't talking to distributors yet.

questions.text: [Internal Pressure] What is the expectation from your HQ or Investors?

options.text: Speed: "Get market share now, worry about profit later."
Safety: "Don't lose money. Test it, but do not burn cash."
Proof: "Show us it works on a small scale, then we unlock the big budget."
Ultimatum: "Fix it or kill it. If performance doesn't improve, we exit."

questions.text: [Market Fit] Which specific customer doubt do you think is killing your sales the most?

options.text: Price: "Is it too expensive?"
Efficacy: "Does it actually work for Vietnamese skin?"
Trust: "Is this a fake product? Is the brand real?"
I have no idea: We honestly don't know why people stop at the "Buy" button.

part4.title: Part D: The Solution (Desired Outcome)
part4.description: This part helps us understand what outcome you value most from DIGICON.

questions.text: What is the single most valuable result DIGICON could give you in the next 60 days?

options.text: Decision: A safe "Go/No-Go" test to see if we should enter.
Learning: Knowing exactly what message/hook makes Vietnamese customers buy.
Leverage: A data pack to prove demand and sign a distributor.
Fixing: Finding the leak in our funnel to increase ROI.

fields.label: Official online buy links (TikTok Shop / Shopee / Lazada / Shopify / Amazon / app store / booking page)
Markets you sell in (countries you are in)
Optional: what tracking data (platform purchase tracking, website analytics, order reports, CRM)
